name: New facts - Can we modify a monk build with this?
author: Cornflower

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
As you know (and probably start to hate) I have been trying to find a solo-build for Blackstone Keep. Now, there are some new stuff online on Blackstone. Here's what's new:
Devastating Critical is now not death, it's double. DevCrit now does double damage if the victim loses the fort save.
Barbarians get up to 2d12 rage-damage with Mighty Rage. (3/day, fairly short duration)
Barbarians get 15% physical immunity with Mighty Rage. (3/day, fairly short duration)
Weapons can now give up to 6d12 damage (theoretially) even before I add +d6 divine, keen, 2d12 Mass Crit and +20AB to them.
Assassin now gets +d6  acid damage for every three levels they take for the class.

With these newfangled ideas abounding, is there finally a Glorious Monk Build available that I can play?

I want 6-10 attacks per round. Assume that my monk can get +12STR, +12WIS and +12DEX as well as uber-kamas. What else do I need? 25% slashing! +6AC on everything. Haste. +15/- dr against Bludgeoning/Slashing/Piercing/Electric/Fire/Acid/Cold. But, before I get to all that, does anyone have a good Monk build that now will blossom in this new enviroment?

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Could you try the Shadowpriest? No Dev Crit, but sweeet defenses and buffs. Pretty sure it's numero uno melee build.

Sent fra min SM-G950F via Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Cornflower!

To clarify you are looking for:
- a Improved Two Weapon Fighting Dual Kama Monk Build
- that can solo a high magic environment with very difficult bosses
- there are plenty of damage and ability buffs to help deal damage with weapons
- assassin gets an additional +6 acid damage every 3 levels without needing to catch an opponent flat footed or flanked, on top of the usual death attack bonus

If I have got this information correct I think you should consider Mick Dagger's Kama-Shinobi here

- Up to 9 attacks per round with flurry and haste, 
- HiPS, 
- undispellable improved invisibility for 50% concealment, 
- 13d6 death attack, 
- death attack DC 38 
- base AB 40 dual wielding Kamas,  which will be buffed to 66 AB with equipment (the cap) and max dex ability bonuses
- 26 assassin levels means additional +48 acid damage per attack (or 432 acid damage per round if every attack hit)
- has UMD for spell casting
- epic dodge and naked 31 AC, 39 reflex save with improved evasion and deflect arrows
- can be a speed demon and run faster than a dungeon master if you combine perma-haste, monk speed and a scroll of expedious retreat
- its also an elf with keen senses!

Finally a build with 70 replies has to be one of very significant interest :)

Maybe there could be some adjustments to get 27 assassin levels (by swapping the level 27 shadowdancer level with assassin?) for extra acid and death attack damage? Mick Dagger might also some suggestions as well, if this is the build that you are interested in? I understand Stagmeister has also played this build through Aielund

Demos in the thread also suggested making a small adjustment to increase Dex further in exchange for Str and Cons to 20 in a high magic environment, for an ending dex of 38 (and extra AB, AC)

What do you think Cornflower?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: It is indeed a wonderful build - still the only eeevil one I've played. Afraid you do need that 5th level of SD for Defensive Roll, and therefore Epic Dodge, and that's worth considerably more than extra acid and DA damage.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Stag for pointing that out, definitely keep those 5 levels of SD then!

Edit: can I point out this is the only build known to man so far, that could turn Stag to the dark side, so it has to be wickedly good

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: ...

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Blame the quiet man above.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Haven't heard from Cornflower - he's probably asleep, or just blown away by how good the Kama-Shinobi build is hes been stunned to silence. 

However I was thinking if Cornflower wants a more simple point and click build however, a certain Kail Pendragon wrote this build, hidden away in the 'unfinished builds' section
SpoilerKail Pendragon wrote in

































I couldn't find a Dex version of such a build, so I have written something up. I think Dex would be better in an environment where damage enchantments of 6d12 per attack can be found. It has 10 extra AC to Kail's build

I could have called it the ultimate woodpecker (I know Valerfor is fond of this term), but settled for 'Kama Whirlwind' instead

Assuming a lot of the monk immune stuff ie mind immunity, poison immunity etc can be obtained through items in a high magic environment so I pumped the Weapon Master levels high for high AB.

I have avoided monk levels pre epic to go for maximum AB power epic levels. I could have gone F10WM28M2 but then I felt it was worth trading 1AB to get Monk Speed and Epic Weapon Specialisation (with 10 attacks / round)

Key features:
AB 52 with mundane kama, 50 with ITWF, 48 with flurry and ITWF.

Flurry and permahaste, +20 AB from enchantments, +6AB from Dex cap (as per Cornflower's information)
= +74 / 71 / 68 / 65 / 62 / 59 / 74 / 71 / 68 / 65 

10 attacks of 1d6 + 6d12 +d6 divine + 6 (WS/EWS) = 10d6 + 60d12 +10d6 +60 = 140 to 900 damage per round (not including criticals, and not including strength bonus damage)

HP 374, 614hp if you can cap Cons 

AC 34 naked (with items, would be 72 AC -> +12 AC from capped wis and dex +6 armor +6 deflection +6 natural +6 dodge)
SpoilerFighter(12), Monk(3), Weapon Master(25), Human STR: 10 CON: 8 INT: 14 01: Fighter(1): Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus: Kama, Weapon Proficiency Exotic 03: Fighter(3): Ambidexterity 05: Fighter(5) 07: Fighter(7) 09: Fighter(9): Spring Attack 11: Weapon Master(1): Weapon of Choice: Kama 13: Weapon Master(3) 15: Weapon Master(5): Improved Critical: Kama 17: Weapon Master(7) 19: Weapon Master(9) 21: Weapon Master(11): Knockdown 23: Weapon Master(13): Epic Weapon Focus: Kama 25: Fighter(12): Epic Weapon Specialization: Kama 27: Weapon Master(14): Great Dexterity II, (DEX=26) 29: Weapon Master(16): Epic Prowess 31: Weapon Master(18) 33: Monk(2): Great Dexterity IV, {Deflect Arrows}, (DEX=30) 35: Weapon Master(21) 37: Monk(3) 39: Weapon Master(24): Great Dexterity VI, (DEX=33) Skillpoints: 221 Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +4, Mind Effects: +2 AB (max, naked): 52 (melee), 43 (ranged) Spell Casting:  01: Discipline(4), Heal(4), Intimidate(2), Save(8),  03: Discipline(1), Heal(1), Intimidate(1), Save(12),  05: Discipline(1), Heal(1), Intimidate(1), Save(16),  07: Discipline(1), Heal(1), Spellcraft(5), Save(12),  09: Discipline(1), Heal(1), Save(18),  11: Discipline(1), Listen(8), Save(17),  13: Discipline(1), Listen(1), Save(21),  15: Discipline(1), Save(29),  17: Discipline(1), Spellcraft(5), Save(27),  19: Discipline(1), Save(35),  21: Discipline(1), Save(43),  23: Discipline(1), Save(51),  25: Discipline(1), Save(59),  27: Discipline(1), Listen(1), Spellcraft(5), Save(31),  29: Discipline(1), Listen(1), Save(37),  31: Discipline(1), Listen(1), Save(43),  33: Discipline(1), Tumble(10), Save(42),  35: Discipline(1), Listen(1), Save(47),  37: Discipline(1), Listen(1), Spellcraft(5), Tumble(5), Save(40),  39: Discipline(1), Listen(3), Save(42), 
Hope that helps! Looking forward to Cornflower's response!

Edited Kama Whirlwind build to set Cons to 8 and Int to 14

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote: Haven't heard from Cornflower - he's probably asleep, or just blown away by how good the Kama-Shinobi build is hes been stunned to silence.
Actually, I was first asleep, then at work. Now I'm reading. Hush.
:-)

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
OK. First. The Kama-Shinobi is very interesting. I'm not sure if I'm ready for a HIPS-er. It's a bit late bloomer (which in my case is not a problem, I have a toon that I can delete/recreate and start at lvl 23ish). Anyway, I need to think about that, but it's an excellent idea.

Second. I like the Kama Whirlwind (I'll try to refrain from calling it Ultimate Woodpecker). It's essentially a kama-fighter with some monk levels for monkish features. It's easy to play, easy to redistribute skills for my personal taste. It's an even later bloomer (again, no big deal). Also, I have an abundance of useful Fighter-stuff laying around (Gloves with DR and STR4, etc, etc) so I can easily get this up and running. Again, an excellent idea. For a quick-build overnight (I guess) it's kinda awesome. Also, with that extremely high AB, I might even drop a few DEX points and put in WIS. I'm not sure I even need 52AB.

I have a simple way to rank builds. AB+AC. The Kenobi is no 7 on my list. This Kama Whirlwind is like top 3 on my list. It's basically a full dex-based fighter, only monk. Interesting. I may just have to try this build. Unless I feel brave and try something new, the Kama-Shinobi. Damn, I need to think about this. And this week too, when I'm away and can't play. Argh. I will over-analyze this for all week!

Either way, I bow (again) to the expertise that is the people of this forum. I'm impressed. Thank you guys!

Now, where did I put my +12Tumble boots, with haste, 6AC, knockdown immunity and the rest....

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Also, side note: 6d12 is not found anywhere. You have to make it and the probability is so small it's ridiculous. First you gather polished gems, which you convert to faceted, etc. It's 3 per level, so... math... 243 gems gives you one Legendary Stone, which gives three random values between d8 (I think) and 2d12. The chance to get each value is not known, but assuming it's "rectangular probability" (don't know the proper English term) the chance of getting three rolls of 2d12 is ... I don't have the time to calculate that... Low! That's not even counting the various damage types you can get. It's possible to get magical, but I've only gotten that once so far, usually it's Fire, Acid, the usual stuff.

The best I have gotten in about a month of playing and gathering gems is 2d10+2d8+d10.

Anyway, just wanted to point out that you're not going to go to the tavern used store and pick up some Kama's with 6d12 bonus damage. That's a serious long-term project.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I can see why you are treading very carefully before investing that amount of time into creating a powerful build - very wise!

Just with the Kama Whirlwind, given what you told me RE skill points perhaps drop Cons from 9 to 8 and increase Int from 13 to 14, for a further extra 43 skill points, if you like. If you are able to hit the Cons cap easily there is no point having an odd Cons number in the build

I'll edit the post I put up with the Kama Whirlwind build in it

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
By the way I would be cautious about dropping the AB too much

52 AB sounds great, but factor in dual wielding and flurry, its really 48 AB 

or more precisely 48/45/42/39/36/33 on the main hand, 48/45 on the off hand and I think 42/39 for the flurry and haste attacks?

If the lower AB attacks don't hit then you lose potentially maybe 25-50% of your damage

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
It's better than that, "free attacks" ignore twf penalties & start from full AB.
Both flurry of blows & haste,  are considered "free attacks", so your full attack sequence would thus be:
74 / 71 / 68 / 65 / 62 / 59 / 76/ 74 / 71/ 76

In the above schedule, the first "free attack" is inserted between the main & off-hand attacks & the second is last.

Grr, these farm-implement masters are annoying but no-doubt effective.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content: Thank you Empyre! The more the merrier! I can't play this week since I'm away at work, so I can dig in and analyze, speculate and in general be nerdy! The Dervish looks especially promising!

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content: Now, if it's true the way I got it, that you only need ONE monk level to get monk Wis AC bonus and 10 attacks and the monk BAB.... If so, then you can make mostly anything. Only trouble is making everything fit. I love that Kama Whirlwind that Orion made. Now, can you somehow edit that so you get the monk level a bit earlier than 26 perhaps? How much AB would you lose if you make it Monk at level 2-5 somewhere? I really suck at calculating those things....

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
If I go Fighter 10/Monk 2/Weapon Master 28, then we can do it without losing any kama AB by saving a feat and reducing the fighter/monk levels from not having to take weapon proficiency exotic. Loss of 1 ranged AB and 1 AB from other weapons which may or may not be important, also monk speed

One thing I was wondering, was if crafting skills are important? Weapon Master doesn't get any crafting skills so dumping skills in it at monk and fighter levels will be important

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Cornflower wrote: Now, if it's true the way I got it, that you only need ONE monk level to get monk Wis AC bonus and 10 attacks and the monk BAB.
That's true, but there are benefits from taking more Monk levels.  Every 3rd level of Monk gives +10% speed, every 5th level of Monk gives +1 AC, Monk 5 gives immunity to disease, Monk 6 gives Knockdown and Improved Knockdown, Monk 11 gives immunity to poison, Monk 12 and higher gives Spell Resistance (Monk level + 10) which cannot be lowered, Monk 18 gives 50% concealment that can be used twice a day, and Monk 20 gives immunity to mental effects.  Of course, there is also Tumble as a class skill.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Yeah, you are right Empyre but this is built for BSK, so many of these extra abilities aren't needed, thus, Orion went for straight AB here.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Every decision make in a build is a trade-off.  You give up something to get something else.  It all depends on what is important to you and where you are playing.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Kama Whirlwind is a straight up very dirty 'max Dex max AB max APR at all costs' type build which loses quite a few features, stuff like Epic Dodge, Uncanny Dodge and Sneak/Death Attack which are normally very valuable to dex'ers are not in the Whirlwind (because of the classes selected)

A more balanced build which has these features such as Empyre65's builds or Mick Dagger's Kama Shinobi would be more suitable as a soloist in WoG. 

As for Blackstone Keep, if Cornflower says all of these damage buffs can be applied to Kamas in Blackstone Keep perhaps there are also ways to work around the abilities lost from not taking those levels in monk from items, such as mind immunity, poison/disease immunity, spell resistance etc and not having uncanny dodge to protect the Dex AC (ie knockdown immune boots, stun/paralysis immunity)

So I wasn't sure it would be necessary to have some of the other features from the build so I gave Cornflower a different option without them

In the end it all depends on the environment and Cornflower is probably the best judge of that

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
The de-facto standard gear I provide to all my new toons are something like this:

lvl 11: Boots of Speed
somewhere in the middle levels a +2d6 / keen / d10 mass crit weapon or similar

lvl 22ish:
Gloves with DR 15/- bludg/pierc/slash
Helmet with immunity mindspells + SR 10
Belt STR5
Ring CON+2/DEX+2/STR+2
Boots CON7 + Haste + Knockdown Immunity
Amulet immunity Death/Fear/level reduction
Ring DR 15/- cold/fire/electric
Armor DR15/- acid

On about three of those I add +4 STR or +4 WIS etc, depending on need.

lvl 38ish:
weapon with +d6 / +d6 / +d6 elemental, 2d10 primary damage, keen, 2d12 mass crit, +20 AB

Then there are some extra things you can find if you're lucky.

I don't run around with much better gear than anyone else. On the contrary, I would say I have basic old-player gear. There are better stuff you can make/find if you play high-level areas constantly. That's my problem, since I play daytime Europe, I have hard time finding people to party with, hence I can't run the real high-level areas. So, I don't have the best gear.

Anyway, that's why I tend to tweak and twist builds in absurdum since I usually don't need stuff that I know I can get easily on gear.

That being said, now that I'm back home, I'm gonna check out Orion's latest version.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content: About Crafting skills. On BSK, if you don't have above 80, don't bother. So crafting skills is usually put on a special crafting toon, a Forger. I have one bard/F/RDD that has crafting 85 when buffed, so I don't need that on the woodp... whirlwind.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I'd love to add uncanny dodge and epic dodge into the build if possible
But I dont see how that is possible without dropping the huge AB boosts from weapon master

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote: I'd love to add uncanny dodge and epic dodge into the build if possible
But I dont see how that is possible without dropping the huge AB boosts from weapon master
Well... Actually, with the amount of hits per round you get on this build, I'm not entirely sure you need all that AB. I do have one +10 EB kama and one +20 AB Kama...
Still, the AB is soo impressive to show.

Come to think of it. If you did put Epic Dodge, you would gain UMD and Tumble as well, i guess. It might be worth it.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:

posts.author: Orion

Sorry Valerfor for ninja'ing you mind you I did just make a Shadowdancer build :)

Cornflower the builds I've written are rough drafts, I probably would suggest including blind fight and either knockdown or called shot in either of the builds I've written up, a point and click version might get a bit stale after a while. 

I like to include blind fight in any serious melee build it is so valuable

The rogue one definitely should have knockdown to try to maximise sneak attack damage, and consider stealth skills

Weapon Finesse at level 15 is kind of annoying by the way, love to get it earlier really but that would lose 1 AB (I think...). At least the rogue version can shoot them with a shortbow until lvl 15, the monk one with sling or shuriken

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Hmm... Orion's Rogue 14 Monk 1 Weapon Master version is kinda interesting. Improved Knockdown is not that essential, since many bosses resist IKD from a small, weak attacker. Blind Fight is more relevant. It gets a gazillion attacks, high AB and Monk AC. Even UMD. So, what's not to love? Twin Kamas come in very late, but since I'm starting at 22ish, that's not a big deal.

Now, can someone knowledgeable confirm the 10 attacks? Also what the numbers are?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yes, as long as they have >26BAB & ITWF, they get the full attack schedule.
Kama whirlwind has 48AB base so that makes it 74AB in your server, then the 10-attack routine would be:

+70/ +67/ +64/ +61/ +58/ +55/ +72(flurry)/ +70/ +67/ +72 (haste).
Flurry attack comes in-between the main & off-hand, haste attack comes last, both ignore twf penalties for sure but I'm not 100% on the flurry penalty.
If another attack (such as from great cleave or an attack of opportunity) comes within the main schedule, they are treated as extra attacks but there is also an absolute limit of 12 attacks/round, due to engine limitations.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Iirc Haste attack ignores both Flurry- and 2WF-penalties.

Attack schedules are parted in 3 segments pr round. The first segment fills first, so with 7 attacks you get tham as 3-2-2. With 10 attacks they come as 4-3-3 which means you won't actually get your AoO in the first segment at all. Also worth noting is that when you attack from stealth, the entire first segment will be sneak attacks/ death attacks. After that it might not.



Sent fra min SM-G950F via Tapatalk

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Thanks, Grim,

In this case, Cornflower, just make the 72's, to 74's, meaning more good news to you.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
One of the last few Bioware patches changed extra attacks so that if you have more than one of them, they are not all at full AB.  For example, a Cleric / Monk using Divine Power, Haste, and Flurry of Blows would have 3 extra attacks, one at full AB, one at -5, and one at -10.  I don't know whether this also applies to Great Cleave, Whirlwind Attack, or Attacks of Opportunity.

OK, I looked it up, and it does also apply to (Great) Cleave and attacks of opportunity, too.  See the Additional Attacks section of this Wiki page:
https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Attacks_per_round
There is also an interesting discussion on the Talk page:
https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Talk:Attacks_per_round

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
It's not worth it now, IKD is not gonna be efficient in your server with 41AB (Dual-Wielding).
Moreover, you get BF very late & even WF is at 18th-level.

Better is to start an easy to level build (human), take it to 15th-level & then substitute that for Kama Whirlwind.
Assuming you have that choice of course.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Would I be remiss in suggesting actually playing the build throughout its levels? Maybe it's the purist coming out in me (yes, again), but it's certainly the best way I can think of to get to know how to actually play any particular build - and indeed a variety of build types. Use the early levels as a training ground to get under the skin of it.

Or maybe that's (still) just me...

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Stag, naturally, I agree with you.

But this is a special case because the build doesn't take "weapon finesse" before 15th-level & before that it can do zero damage/ close to zero.

If it takes "weapon finesse" earlier, then it pushes weapon-master beyond 13th-level, leaving it with not only a lowered AB but also with fewer attacks.

Yeah, it's a special snowflake, that one...

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: If it takes "weapon finesse" earlier, then it pushes weapon-master beyond 13th-level, leaving it with not only a lowered AB but also with fewer attacks.

Yeah, it's a special snowflake, that one...
There is always the option to use a bow and sneak attack until you get weapon finesse.

I felt it better to convert that charming elf instead of doing the same quests for the 26th time. I feel slighty ashamed, though. For real.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
OK, after a lot of thinking, compromising and considering which gear I actually have available, also test-building it so I know it's legal, this is what I went with. It's a mix between the original F/R/M I got from a friend on BSK, Orion's suggested improvements and a lot of moving feats/switching classes and all that. I think the WM build is not good enough to trade away all the UMD and skills you get from the Rogue. On the other hand, the backstabbing damage is not important enough to prioritize away the extra feats from Fighter, and so forth. Also, it's playable from lvl 1 (see, there Stag!). Anyway, here it is:
